title: Software Engineer II
description:
We are seeking a Software Engineer II to help accelerate our industry leading Driver Safety/Fleet Management Software.â€¯ Our products manage massive amounts of data collected from over 700,000 vehicles worldwide.â€¯ We use the data and video to derive intelligent insights using Video Telematics, Machine Vision and AI for all devices and vehicles on the network.â€¯â€¯ As a Software Engineer I, you have the opportunity to work the full SDLC including, technical requirements, software design, development, unit testing and deployment of production software features and components in an Agile environment. Your efforts will enable customer self\\-service functionality for direct and indirect products.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Rapidly prototype, deploy, and test new solutions within our markets
* Provide state\\-of\\-the\\-art user experiences across mobile and desktop solutions
* Build out scalable solutions to manage events and real\\-time status of close to a million independent devices
* Own and operate scalable production services and user interface
* Develop and test new solutions that enhance our position within our markets.
* Passionate about learning and helping others


**What You Need**
* 1\\+ years of engineering experience
* 1\\+ years of development of multi\\-tier web services experience
* Proficiency with Source Code management techniques, preferably Git Flow.
* Proficiency with AWS ecosystem EC2, S3 (AWS certifications being a plus)
* Proficiency with C\\#.
* Proficiency in PostgreSQL, RDS or MongoDB/Atlas.


**Nice To Have**
* Proficiency in Angular 2\\+/ReactJS for multi\\-platform UI development (preferred)
* Experience with NestJS framework, Stencil.js
* Experience with Messaging systems \\- Kafka.
* Proficiency with K8S or alternative container lifecycle management systems.


**Innovation Lives Here**
**You go all in no matter what you do, and so do we. At Lytx, weâ€™re powered by cutting\\-edge technology and Happy People. You want your work to make a positive impact in the world, and thatâ€™s what we do. Join our diverse team of hungry, humble and capable people united to make a difference.**
**Together, we help save lives on our roadways.**
**Find out how good it feels to be a part of an inclusive, collaborative team. Weâ€™re committed to delivering an environment where everyone feels valued, included and supported to do their best work and share their voices.**
**Lytx, Inc. is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and maintains a drug\\-free workplace. Weâ€™re committed to attracting, retaining and maximizing the performance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. EOE/M/F/Disabled/Vet.**

title: Technical Lead
description:
**Technical Lead â€” AI\\-Native Product Engineering**
**About Us**
 We are an early\\-stage R\\&D startup building an AI\\-native work and collaboration platform. We are rethinking workplace communication and productivity tools by making AI a first\\-class participantâ€” designed and built\\-in from day one, not retrofitted later.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 We are seeking a Technical Lead â€” Product Engineering (Full Stack) to provide strong technical guidance to a team of engineers. This is a hands\\-on technical leadership role, reporting directly to the Technical Architect.
   

  

**Primary Focus:**
 Enable engineers to move faster and build better by unblocking them technically, reviewing work, guiding sound technical decisions, and maintaining high standards of code quality and consistency. You will own end\\-to\\-end product delivery, focusing on building and shipping new features rather than maintaining or supporting legacy systems.
   

  

 This role does not require prior people management experience; however, we are looking for someone with the potential to grow into broader leadership responsibilities over time.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Provide technical direction and unblock engineers on complex problems.
* Review code (including AI\\-assisted code) for correctness, quality, and maintainability.
* Debug complex issues and guide effective root\\-cause analysis.
* Ensure architectural consistency and code quality across the codebase.
* Mentor engineers and help develop strong technical judgment.
* Collaborate closely with the Technical Architect on implementation strategies.
* Evaluate tools, frameworks, and technologies as required.


**Important: If you can confidently answer at least one of the questions in the attached assessment, we invite you to apply for this role.**
**Requirements**
**Required Qualifications**
**Must Have**
* 5â€“8 years of hands\\-on software engineering experience.
* Proven experience building and shipping B2B or consumer products (not services or client based projects).
* Strong full\\-stack development expertise in TypeScript and/or Python.
* Experience working on real\\-time systems (e.g., messaging, presence, live collaboration).
* Strong debugging, problem\\-solving, and analytical skills.
* Experience conducting code reviews and mentoring engineers.
* Clear and effective technical communication skills.
* Based in Bangalore and willing to work on\\-site.


**Good to Have**
* Experience integrating or building applications using AI/LLM technologies.
* Prior experience with communication or collaboration platforms.
* Experience with multi\\-tenant SaaS architectures.
* Exposure to early\\-stage startup environments


**Work Location**
 Location: Buzzworks @ Skybridge
   

  

 World Trade Center Campus 26/1,
   

  

 Dr. Rajkumar Road Malleshwaramâ€“Rajajinagar
   

  

 Bengaluru â€“ 560055\\.
   

  

**Mode of Work: In Office (On\\-site)**
 If you are excited about building next\\-generation AI\\-native products with global impact, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Please send your updated resume along with a brief note on why this role interests you to talent@colligence.in
   

  

 To help us process your application efficiently, kindly include the following details in your email body:
   

  

* Current Company:
